title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
---

WeWork Inc. became a publicly traded company in October. A Business News article on Thursday about the office-sharing company incorrectly said it went public last month.

(See: "Business News: WeWork To Restate Nearly Two Years Of Results" -- WSJ Dec. 2, 2021)

---

Bob Chapek succeeded Robert Iger as Walt Disney Co.'s chief executive. In some editions Thursday, a Business & Finance article about the company incorrectly referred to Mr. Chapek as Mr. Iger's predecessor.

---

Notice to readers

Some Wall Street Journal staff members are working remotely during the pandemic. Please send reader comments only by email or phone, using the contacts below, not via U.S. Mail.

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
